title: Harry Jodoin Joins Mopar/Magneti-Marelli
persons: Harry Jodoin Joins Mopar/Magneti-Marelli Harry Jodoin Joins Mopar/Magneti-Marelli
text: Harry Jodoin Joins Mopar/Magneti-Marelli , 12 September 2015 -- Automotive executive Harry Jodoin joined auto supply company Mopar/Magneti-MarelliHarry Jodoin has worked in the automotive industry in Canada for 30 years. He started as a parts depot worker for Mazda Canada in 1985 and rose to become the National Sales Manager for Kia Canada in 2012. Jodoin joined auto supply company Mopar/Magneti-Marelli as the National Program Director. The company supplies parts and other supplies to Fiat Chrysler Automobiles Canada. Harry Jodoin has spent his entire career trying to improve the sales systems and communications networks of the companies he has worked for. Jodoin showed commitment to his career when he decided to live in Toronto full time, and his stubborn commitment to excellence has separated him from other top-level executives in the Canadian automotive industry. Harry Jodoin has managed to help his employers realize their marketing and sales goals domestically throughout his career. His ability as a manager and a salesman are well known in all of the companies he has spent any time at. Jodoin, starting a new chapter in his career, will continue his excellent work in the Canadian automotive industry. Today, Harry Jodoin manages many operations at Mopar/Magneti-Marelli. He recruits and retains top national automotive wholesale parts personnel—. These workers also have to manage customer relations and keep clients happy and satisfied throughout their relationships with Mopar. Jodoin also works with clients to manage expectations and commitments. He always tries to under-promise and over-deliver with clients at all times, giving them reasons to trust him and Mopar as a company. Harry Jodoin, in his work for Mopar-Magneti-Marelli, will monitor program objectives and give critical performance feedback to all involved in program development. In addition to feedback, Jodoin will also give critical oversight to those involved in program development and push the program in a client-centric direction. He is responsible for his team’s performance and for the program to satisfy and exceed company goals in the long- and short-term. Jodoin will help Mopar develop sales and marketing programs that will vault the company into the big leagues of the Canadian automotive industry.
